options.title: No parts
options.description:
Choose **No parts** if you don't currently have the spare parts
and consumables required for the procedure. You can come back
with the parts later, or order them.

options.title: No tools
options.description:
Choose **No tools** if you don't have the required tools or other
equipment (like lifting equipment) needed to finish the repairs.
You can come back later, or ask for support.

options.title: No time
options.description:
Choose **No time** if working hours are over, or if you have
another appointment you must keep, and you will come back for this later.

escape/general/no-parts.title: Order parts
escape/general/no-parts.question: Do you need to order parts?

escape/general/order-parts-done.title: Order sent
escape/general/order-parts-done.question: Order received
escape/general/order-parts-done.description:
Your order has been received. You can continue this service call by
entering the machine serial number again.

escape/general/continue-later.title: Continue later
escape/general/continue-later.question: Continue later
escape/general/continue-later.description:
Your progress is saved. You can continue this service call by
entering the machine serial number again.

input.description: Please describe the problem to the best of your understanding
The serial number can be found at the back of the machine

qrcode.label: Get from QR code
qrcode.description: Read the QR code on the alert message or go to the Service > Machine info menu

service/identify-machine.title: Machine
service/identify-machine.question: Which model is your machine?
service/identify-machine.description:
Choose the model of your machine from the list provided.
The machine identifier can be seen behind the machine on
the top right corner of the nameplate.

service/request-help.title: Request help
service/request-help.question: Please call +90-232-363-0000 for help
service/request-help.description:
We are sorry that we couldn't find a solution immediately. Our staff
is always happy to help and solve your problem. Just give us a call.

td/alarm/alarm-code.title: Alarm code
td/alarm/alarm-code.question: What is the alarm code on the screen?
td/alarm/alarm-code.description:
Press the menu button and select "alarms". You can scroll through the
logged alarms.

processes.title: Check the vacuum related system parameters
steps: Shut off electricity to the dryer by pressing the "Emergency Stop" button.
Press and hold the "Up Direction" button.
Release the "Emergency Stop" button to power on the dryer.
Enter the password by pressing the up-down direction buttons to change the numbers in each digit and press the stop-start (left-right direction) buttons to change the digits.
Complete the password entry by pressing the "OK" button.
The controller will display the first parameter in the list.
Check the 59. and 60. parameters to see if they have been changed by pressing the up-down direction buttons to change the parameter number.

td/vacuum-alarm/revert-parameters-to-ori.title: Revert parameters back to original settings

processes.title: Revert the vacuum parameters back to their original settings
steps: Select the changed vacuum parameter.
Press the "OK" button to switch to value editing mode.
Change the values by pressing the up-down direction buttons. Change digits by pressing the stop-start (left-right direction) buttons.
When the value has been defined press the "Cancel" button to return to the parameter menu.
Press the "Cancel" button in the parameter menu and answer the question "Save ?" with "Y" (Yes) to save the changes.
If another vacuum parameter has been changed, too, repeat the steps 1 to 6 for the related parameter.

processes.title: Run a program to monitor the problem
steps: Select any program on the main screen
Press the "OK" button to enter the program screen
Press the "Start" button to start the program

td/vacuum-alarm/revert-parameters-to-ori.question: Is the problem solved?

processes.title: Check the operation of the sail switch
steps: Open the electic cabinet door
Enter the Diagnostics menu
Select DI4 (Vacuum DI)
Press the sail switch flap
Check if the DI4 value is changing when you press and release the flap

processes.title: Check the closing of the loading door
steps: Check if the loading door is air tight

td/vacuum-alarm/check-lint-filter-closin.title: Check closing of Lint Filter Door

processes.title: Check the closing of the lint filter door
steps: Check if the lint filter door is air tight

td/vacuum-alarm/check-lint-filter-closin.question: Is it closing?

td/vacuum-alarm/fix-loading-door-closing.title: Fix closing of Loading Door Problem

processes.title: Fix the closing problem of the loading door
steps: Fix the air gap of the loading door

processes.title: Run a program to monitor the problem
steps: Select any program on the main screen
Press the "OK" button to enter the program screen
Press the "Start" button to start the program

td/vacuum-alarm/fix-loading-door-closing.question: Is the problem solved?

processes.title: Close the lint filter door correctly
steps: Close the lint filter door to make the machine air tight

processes.title: Run a program to monitor the problem
steps: Select any program on the main screen
Press the "OK" button to enter the program screen
Press the "Start" button to start the program

processes.title: Check the dustiness of the lint filter
steps: Check if the lint filter is dusty

processes.title: Clean the lint filter
steps: Clean the lint filter by using a brush

processes.title: Run a program to monitor the problem
steps: Select any program on the main screen
Press the "OK" button to enter the program screen
Press the "Start" button to start the program

processes.title: Check the rotation direction of the fan motor
steps: Open the rear middle panel
Start any program
Check the fan motor to see its rotation direction. The correct direction is stated by the direction label.
Stop the program

processes.title: Fix the rotation direction of the fan motor
steps: Turn off the power
Open the rear middle panel
Open the fan motor cover
Change the directivity of two cables coming from the source electrical terminal
Close the fan motor cover
Close the rear middle panel
Turn on the power
Check if the fan motor is rotating in the correct direction

processes.title: Run a program to monitor the problem
steps: Select any program on the main screen
Press the "OK" button to enter the program screen
Press the "Start" button to start the program

processes.title: Check the exhaust outlet
steps: Turn off the power
Wait for the exhaust pipes to cooldown
Unbolt the exhaust pipeline from the machine
Inspect the exhaust pipeline to see if it's clogged visually

processes.title: Clean/Clear the exhaust
steps: Clean the exhaust
Bolt the exhaust pipeline back to the machine

processes.title: Run a program to monitor the problem
steps: Select any program on the main screen
Press the "OK" button to enter the program screen
Press the "Start" button to start the program

processes.title: Check the flap of the sail switch
steps: Open the electic cabinet door
Start any program
Check the sail switch flap in the electric cabinet to see if it's being sucked by the vacuum and it sticks to the opening

processes.title: Replace the sail switch flap
steps: Turn off the power
Open the rear middle panel
Open the sail switch cover by unbolting the flap bolts
Take out the faulty flap from its slit. Note the slit being used.
Insert the new flap into the correct slit
Close the sail switch cover by bolting the flap bolts
Close the rear middle panel
Turn on the power

processes.title: Run a program to monitor the problem
steps: Select any program on the main screen
Press the "OK" button to enter the program screen
Press the "Start" button to start the program

processes.title: Check the sail switch flap pallet
steps: Turn off power
Open the rear middle panel
Check the sail switch flap pallet to see if it's bent

processes.title: Reset the sail switch flap
steps: Unbolt the sail switch bolts
Reset the sail switch to align the sail switch flap pallet to the correct position
Bolt the sail switch bolts

processes.title: Run a program to monitor the problem
steps: Select any program on the main screen
Press the "OK" button to enter the program screen
Press the "Start" button to start the program

td/vacuum-alarm/check-sail-switch-termin.title: Check Cable between Sail Switch and Electric Terminal

processes.title: Check the cable between the sail switch and the electric terminal
steps: Turn off the power
Open the rear middle panel
Unplug the power plugs from the sail switch
Detach the vacuum sensor cables from the Electric Terminal
Check the contiunity between the terminals of the cable pairs by using a multimeter

td/vacuum-alarm/check-sail-switch-termin.question: Is the cable functional?

td/vacuum-alarm/replace-sail-switch-term.title: Replace Cable between Sail Switch and Electric Terminal

processes.title: Replace/Repair the cable between the sail switch and the electric terminal
steps: Turn off the power
Remove the faulty cable
Replace it with a new cable
Plug in the cable plugs on its switch side terminals
Plug the terminal plugs onto the sail switch terminals
Insert the terminals on the electric terminal side into their sockets

processes.title: Run a program to monitor the problem
steps: Select any program on the main screen
Press the "OK" button to enter the program screen
Press the "Start" button to start the program

td/vacuum-alarm/replace-sail-switch-term.question: Is the problem solved?

td/vacuum-alarm/check-terminal-control-p.title: Check Cable between Electric Terminal and Control Panel

processes.title: Check the cable between the electric terminal and the control panel
steps: Turn off the power
Detach the vacuum sensor cables from the Electric Terminal
Detach the vacuum sensor cables from the Control Panel
Check the continuity between the terminals of the cable pairs by using a multimeter

td/vacuum-alarm/check-terminal-control-p.question: Is the cable functional?

td/vacuum-alarm/replace-terminal-control.title: Replace Cable between Electric Terminal and Control Panel

processes.title: Replace/Repair the cable between the electric terminal and the control panel
steps: Turn off the power
Remove the faulty cable
Replace it with a new cable
Attach the vacuum sensor cables to the Electric Terminal
Attach the vacuum sensor cables to the Control Panel

processes.title: Run a program to monitor the problem
steps: Select any program on the main screen
Press the "OK" button to enter the program screen
Press the "Start" button to start the program

td/vacuum-alarm/replace-terminal-control.question: Is the problem solved?

processes.title: Change the DI assignment for the Vacuum Sensor
steps: Shut off electricity to the dryer by pressing the "Emergency Stop" button
Press and hold the "Menu" button
Release the "Emergency Stop" button to power on the dryer
Enter the password by pressing the up-down direction buttons to change the numbers in each digit and press the stop-start (left-right direction) buttons to change the digits
Complete the password entry by pressing the "OK" button
Select the Digital Input (DI) menu by pressing the up-down direction buttons
Press the "OK" button to enter the DI menu
Select DI4 by pressing the up-down direction buttons
Press the "OK" button to set the DI4 value
Press the up-down direction buttons to select an available input
Press the "OK" button to save the changes

td/vacuum-alarm/send-cp-to-service.title: Send the CP to the service
td/vacuum-alarm/send-cp-to-service.question: Thanks

we110/alarm/alarm-code.title: Alarm code
we110/alarm/alarm-code.question: What is the alarm code?
we110/alarm/alarm-code.description:
Check the screen for the alarm code, Or use the QR code reader on the screen.
If you dismissed the alarm popup, you can get it again by going to the "Alarm statistics" page
on the machine.

we110/heater-fail/heating-type.question: Is this a steam-heated machine
we110/heater-fail/heating-type.description: Is there a steam valve going in?

processes.title: Check the steam pressure
steps: Check the steam gage on the steam valve
The gauge should read between 4-6 bar

processes.title: Check the Steam Heating DO on the Diagnostic

steps.0.00: Enter the "Main" menu by selecting and pressing the "Menu" button
steps.5.00: Enter the "Service" menu by selecting and pressing the "Service" button
steps.9.00: Enter the "Diagnostics" screen by selecting and pressing the "Diagnostics" button (The "Manual Control" button on versions prior to 1.0)
steps.15.00: Select the "Steam Valve" DO on the "Digital Outputs" frame
steps.19.00: Press the "OK" button to activate the "Steam Valve" DO
steps.23.00: Insert one lead of the multimeter to any socket between the 12. and the 22. sockets on the S11 socket group and insert the other lead of the multimeter to the 7. socket on the S13 socket group

we110/steam/heater-fail/steam-heating-do.title: Steam Heating DO available

processes.title: Check the Steam Heating DO availability

steps.0.00: Enter the "Main" menu by selecting and pressing the "Menu" button
steps.7.00: Enter the "Service" menu by selecting and pressing the "Service" button
steps.11.00: Enter the "I/O Link" screen by selecting and pressing the "I/O Link" button
steps.38.00: Press the "OK" button to enter the edit mode
steps.40.00: Change the current DO to one of the available DOs by pressing the up-down direction buttons

we110/steam/heater-fail/steam-heating-do.question: Are there any unused available DOs?

we110/steam/heater-fail/change-steam-hea.title: Change Steam Heating DO

processes.title: Change the DO assignment for the Steam Heating

steps.0.00: Press the "OK" button to assign the target DO
steps.7.00: Press the "Exit" button to exit. At this stage the software will ask you if you want to save the changes. To save your changes select the "Yes" button by pressing the left-right direction buttons and press the "OK" button to confirm the selection
steps.10.00: The software will return to the "Service" menu
steps.16.00: Detach the S13 socket plug from the back of the Control Panel
steps.28.00: Remove the 7. socket terminal from the S13 socket plug by pushing down the fins of the socket terminal with the terminal removal tool
steps.50.00: Attach the S13 socket plug into the S13 socket
steps.55.00: Raise up the fins of the socket terminal with the terminal removal tool
steps.71.00: Detach the S19 socket plug from the back of the Control Panel
steps.76.00: Insert the socket terminal into the 6. socket of the S19 socket plug which corresponds to the DO which has been assigned in the DO assignment step in this video (Step no 1). Warning: You have to select the corresponding socket and socket plug if you choose another DO for this procedure. You can find a list of the DOs and their corresponding sockets on the back of the Control Panel
steps.83.00: Attach the S19 socket plug into the S19 socket
steps.89.00: Enter the "Diagnostic" screen by selecting and pressing the "Diagnostic" button
steps.95.00: Select the "Steam Valve" DO on the "Digital Outputs" frame
steps.100.00: Press the "OK" button to activate the "Steam Valve" DO
steps.104.00: Check the voltage value by inserting one lead of the multimeter into any socket between the 12. and the 22. sockets on the S11 socket group and inserting the other lead of the multimeter into the 6. socket on the S19 socket group

we110/steam/heater-fail/change-steam-hea.question: Does Â±24V DC exist on the DO?

processes.title: Check the cable between the steam control valve and the CP

steps.0.00: Unscrew the control valve socket holder screw from the steam control valve coil by using a screwdriver
steps.10.00: Detach the steam valve coil socket from the steam control valve coil
steps.17.00: Detach the terminal block of the socket from its housing by using the screwdriver as a lever
steps.22.00: Check the voltage between the terminals of the terminal block by using a voltmeter

processes.title: Replace/Repair the cable between the Steam Control Valve and the CP

steps.0.00: Open the rear cover, the top covers, and the front left door and replace the cable

processes.title: Check the Steam Valve DO on the Diagnostic

steps.0.00: Enter the "Main" menu by selecting and pressing the "Menu" button
steps.5.00: Enter the "Service" menu by selecting and pressing the "Service" button
steps.9.00: Enter the "Diagnostics" screen by selecting and pressing the "Diagnostics" button (The "Manual Control" button on versions prior to 1.0)
steps.15.00: Select the "Steam Valve" DO on the "Digital Outputs" frame
steps.19.00: Press the "OK" button to activate the "Steam Valve" DO

processes.title: Check the Steam Valve DO on the Diagnostic

steps.0.00: Enter the "Main" menu by selecting and pressing the "Menu" button
steps.5.00: Enter the "Service" menu by selecting and pressing the "Service" button
steps.9.00: Enter the "Diagnostics" screen by selecting and pressing the "Diagnostics" button (The "Manual Control" button on versions prior to 1.0)
steps.15.00: Select the "Steam Valve" DO on the "Digital Outputs" frame
steps.19.00: Press the "OK" button to activate the "Steam Valve" DO

processes.title: Check the coil of the steam control valve

steps.0.00: Check the resistance value between the terminals of the steam control valve coil terminals by using a multimeter
steps.16.00: Attach the terminal block of the socket into its housing
steps.20.00: Insert the socket holder screw into its screw hole
steps.24.00: Attach the steam valve coil socket onto the steam control valve coil
steps.29.00: Screw the coil socket onto the coil via its holder screw by using a screwdriver

processes.title: Replace the coil of the Steam Control Valve

steps.0.00: Unbolt the plastic nut which fastens the coil onto the coil armature on the back of the valve
steps.11.00: Remove the coil from the steam control valve by pulling it downwards from the front side of the coil along the armature (back of the machine)
steps.24.00: Install the new coil onto the steam control valve by pushing it upwards from the front side until the coil reaches the base of the armature (back of the machine)
steps.39.00: Bolt the plastic nut which fastens the coil onto the armature whilst pushing the coil upwards
steps.52.00: Attach the steam valve coil socket onto the new coil
steps.57.00: Screw the coil socket onto the coil via its holder screw by using a screwdriver

processes.title: Run a program to monitor the problem
steps: Select any program on the main screen
Press the "OK" button to enter the program screen
Press the "Start" button to start the program

we110/steam/heater-fail/check-hose-pisto.title: Check Hose Between Steam Piston Valve and Steam Control Valve

processes.title: Check the reliability of the hose between the Steam Piston Valve and the Steam Control Valve

steps.0.00:
Check the reliability of the hose between the Steam Piston Valve and the
Steam Control Valve by detaching the hose from the steam output fitting
of the Steam Control Valve and observing the air flow

we110/steam/heater-fail/check-hose-pisto.question: Is the hose valid?

we110/steam/heater-fail/replace-hose-pis.title: Replace Hose Between Steam Piston Valve and Steam Control Valve

processes.title: Replace the hose between the Steam Piston Valve and the Steam Control Valve

steps.0.00: Unplug the hose from the steam control valve
steps.5.00: Follow the cable route and free the cable from its clips
steps.20.00: Unplug the other end of the hose from the steam valve
steps.25.00: Plug the new hose into the steam valve and get the hose clipsed and plug the other end of the hose into the steam control valve

processes.title: Run a program to monitor the problem
steps: Select any program on the main screen
Press the "OK" button to enter the program screen
Press the "Start" button to start the program

we110/steam/heater-fail/replace-hose-pis.question: Is the problem solved?

we110/steam/heater-fail/check-air-steam-.title: Check air input of Steam Piston Valve

processes.title: Check the air input of the Steam Piston Valve

steps.9.00: Unplug the air hose from its fitting on the steam piston valve
steps.11.00: Check the airflow by holding the tip of the hose towards your hand or towards something which can flap by airflow

we110/steam/heater-fail/check-air-steam-.question: Is the piston valve functioning?

processes.title: Replace the Steam Piston Valve

steps.0.00: Unplug the air hose from its fitting on the steam piston valve
steps.10.00: Detach the steam piston valve from the connection pipe by unbolting it using a pipe wrench
steps.42.00: Attach the new steam piston valve onto the connection pipe by bolting it using a pipe wrench. Tighten the valve whilst bolting it
steps.104.00: Plug the air hose into the fitting on the steam piston valve
steps.114.00: Select the "Steam Valve" DO on the "Digital Outputs" frame
steps.118.00: Press the "OK" button to activate the "Steam Valve" DO
steps.120.00: Press the "OK" button to deactivate the "Steam Valve" DO
steps.124.00: Check the movement of the indicator rod on the steam piston valve visually

processes.title: Run a program to monitor the problem
steps: Select any program on the main screen
Press the "OK" button to enter the program screen
Press the "Start" button to start the program

we110/steam/heater-fail/problem-solved.title: Problem solved
we110/steam/heater-fail/problem-solved.question: Looks like your problem is solved :)

The control panel needs to be serviced in the factory. Please contact
Tolon at service@tolon.com for instructions.

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/check-alarm.title: Check alarm

processes.title: Check the 'Emergency Stop' alarm status
steps: Check the screen for the alert box

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/check-alarm.question: Has the alarm message been removed?

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/button-pressed.title: Check button pressed state

processes.title: Check the Emergency Stop Button mechanically
steps: Press the ESB to check if the button can be pressed

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/button-pressed.question: Is the button in the pressed state?

processes.title: Release the ESB
steps: Twist the Emergency Stop Button clockwise âŸ³ to release it
The button should be pushed up by its springs

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/release-esb-ch.title: Check alarm

processes.title: Check the 'Emergency Stop' alarm status
steps: Check the screen for the alert box

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/release-esb-ch.question: Has the alarm message been removed?

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/replace-esb.title: Replace ESB

processes.title: Open the left front panel

steps.0: Check the screen for the alert box
steps.00:00.00: You will need the door latch key

processes.title: Replace the ESB
steps: Unscrew the ESB cable terminals from the ESB contact socket
Remove the contact of the ESB from its back by using a screwdriver
Unbolt the plastic nut from the back of the ESB
Pull the ESB from the front of the CP
Put a new ESB into the empty ESB slot
Bolt the plastic nut onto its bolt at the back of the ESB
Plug the contact of the ESB into its socket
Screw the ESB cable terminals into the ESB contact socket

processes.title: Close the left front panel
steps: Close the panel
Fix the latch
Screw back the two fixing screws on the left edge

processes.title: Check the 'Emergency Stop' alarm status
steps: Check the screen for the alert box

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/replace-esb.question: Has the alarm message been removed?

processes.title: Turn the power off
steps: Twist the power switch 90Â° anti-clockwise â¤¿

processes.title: Open the left front panel

steps.0.00: You will need the door latch key

processes.title: Check the contacts on the ESB
steps:
Check the conductivity of the contact sockets with short-circuit test
by inserting the multimeter leads into the contact sockets or the contact
screws and testing for both positions of the contact switch. The contact
should be in short-circuit when the switch is in open position (unpressed)
and the contrary in closed position (pressed)

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/replace-esb-co.title: Replace ESB contact

processes.title: Open the left front panel

steps.0: Check the screen for the alert box
steps.0.00: You will need the door latch key

processes.title: Replace the contact on the ESB
steps: Unscrew the ESB cable terminals from the ESB contact socket
Remove the contact of the ESB from its back by using a screwdriver
Plug the new ESB contact into its socket
Screw the ESB cable terminals into the ESB contact socket

processes.title: Check the 'Emergency Stop' alarm status
steps: Check the screen for the alert box

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/replace-esb-co.question: Has the alarm message been removed?
